definitions: A person or company that organizes shipments for individuals or corporations to get goods from the manufacturer or producer to a market, customer, or final point of distribution.
A machine used in logging for carrying felled logs from the stump to a roadside landing.
One who promotes or advances something.
examples: The freight forwarder handled the customs paperwork.
The logger operated a heavy-duty forwarder.
He acted as a forwarder of the new political movement.
